title: How to Recover Your Xbox Account on PC or Mac

steps.headline: Go to https://account.live.com/password/reset in a web browser.
steps.description: You can use any web browser on your computer to access the password reset tool. You must have access to the email address that’s associated with your Xbox account to use this method.

steps.headline: Select “I forgot my password” and click Next.
Enter your e-mail address, phone number, or Skype username.
steps.description: Be sure to use the address, number, or username that’s associated with your Xbox account.

steps.headline: Type the characters you see in the image.
steps.description: This is just to verify that you aren’t a robot. If you are having trouble deciphering the characters, click New to load new ones, or click Audio to hear them spoken aloud.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: Microsoft will send a recovery code to the e-mail address associated with your Xbox account. It may take a few moments for the email to come through.

steps.headline: Enter the code and click Next.
steps.description: This brings you to a screen that allows you to reset your password.

steps.headline: Enter and confirm your new password.
steps.description: You must type the password exactly the same into both boxes.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: A confirmation will appear, letting you know that your account has been recovered.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: Your password is now reset. Now you should be able to sign in to your Xbox account using your new password. If you are unable to recover your Microsoft password using this method, visit https://account.live.com/acsr to fill out the online account recovery form. You must answer questions to prove your identity. Your answers will be reviewed by someone at Microsoft within 24 hours. Make sure your Xbox is nearby, as you’ll have to provide your Xbox One device ID (under Console info & updates in the All Settings area of your Xbox’s settings) or Xbox 360 console ID (under System Info in the Console Settings area of your System settings).

steps.headline: Go to https://login.live.com in a web browser.
steps.description: You can use any web browser on your computer, such as Chrome or Firefox. Use this method if you don’t remember which email address you use to access your Xbox account. If you are unable to use this method, try checking your email accounts for confirmation messages from Xbox. You can search for “Xbox Live” or “Microsoft billing” using your email provider’s search feature.

steps.headline: Try logging in with the email address you think you use for Xbox.
steps.description: Be sure to type the email address correctly, as a typo can prevent you from accessing your account. If you are not able to sign in, you’ll need to try another method.

steps.headline: Click Services & subscriptions.
steps.description: It’s in the blue bar at the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Learn more under “Xbox Live.” It’s under the “More Services” header.
steps.description: This redirects you to Xbox.com. If you see Get more info instead of Learn more, click that instead.

steps.headline: Find the gamertag at the top-right corner of the screen.
steps.description: This is the name next to the avatar. If the email address you used to sign in associated with your Xbox live account, you should see your gamertag. If you don’t see your gamertag, try to sign in with another email address. If you are unable to recover your Microsoft password using this method, visit https://account.live.com/acsr to fill out the online account recovery form. You must answer questions to prove your identity. Your answers will be reviewed by someone at Microsoft within 24 hours. Make sure your Xbox is nearby, as you’ll have to provide your Xbox One device ID (under Console info & updates in the All Settings area of your Xbox’s settings) or Xbox 360 console ID (under System Info in the Console Settings area of your System settings).

steps.headline: Go to https://login.live.com in a web browser.
steps.description: You can use any web browser on your computer, such as Chrome or Firefox. Use this method if you don’t remember which email address you use to access your Xbox account. If you are unable to use this method, try checking your email accounts for confirmation messages from Xbox. You can search for “Xbox Live” or “Microsoft billing” using your email provider’s search feature.

steps.headline: Try logging in with the email address you think you use for Xbox.
steps.description: Be sure to type the email address correctly, as a typo can prevent you from accessing your account. If you are not able to sign in, you’ll need to try another method.

steps.headline: Click Services & subscriptions.
steps.description: It’s in the blue bar at the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Xbox Live Settings under “Xbox Live.” You’ll find it under the “Subscriptions” header.
steps.description: This will send you a security code to verify your account. You’ll also be redirected to Xbox.com.

steps.headline: Find the gamertag at the top-right corner of the screen.
steps.description: This is the name next to the avatar. If the email address you used to sign in associated with your Xbox live account, you should see your gamertag. If you don’t see your gamertag, try to sign in with another email address. If you are unable to recover your Microsoft password using this method, visit https://account.live.com/acsr to fill out the online account recovery form. You must answer questions to prove your identity. Your answers will be reviewed by someone at Microsoft within 24 hours. Make sure your Xbox is nearby, as you’ll have to provide your Xbox One device ID (under Console info & updates in the All Settings area of your Xbox’s settings) or Xbox 360 console ID (under System Info in the Console Settings area of your System settings).

text: Resetting your Microsoft Password Go to https://account.live.com/password/reset in a web browser. You can use any web browser on your computer to access the password reset tool. You must have access to the email address that’s associated with your Xbox account to use this method. Select “I forgot my password” and click Next.  Enter your e-mail address, phone number, or Skype username. Be sure to use the address, number, or username that’s associated with your Xbox account. Type the characters you see in the image. This is just to verify that you aren’t a robot. If you are having trouble deciphering the characters, click New to load new ones, or click Audio to hear them spoken aloud. Click Next. Microsoft will send a recovery code to the e-mail address associated with your Xbox account. It may take a few moments for the email to come through. Enter the code and click Next. This brings you to a screen that allows you to reset your password. Enter and confirm your new password. You must type the password exactly the same into both boxes. Click Next. A confirmation will appear, letting you know that your account has been recovered. Click Next. Your password is now reset. Now you should be able to sign in to your Xbox account using your new password. If you are unable to recover your Microsoft password using this method, visit https://account.live.com/acsr to fill out the online account recovery form. You must answer questions to prove your identity. Your answers will be reviewed by someone at Microsoft within 24 hours. Make sure your Xbox is nearby, as you’ll have to provide your Xbox One device ID (under Console info & updates in the All Settings area of your Xbox’s settings) or Xbox 360 console ID (under System Info in the Console Settings area of your System settings). Recovering Your Email Address (Free Subscription) Go to https://login.live.com in a web browser. You can use any web browser on your computer, such as Chrome or Firefox. Use this method if you don’t remember which email address you use to access your Xbox account. If you are unable to use this method, try checking your email accounts for confirmation messages from Xbox. You can search for “Xbox Live” or “Microsoft billing” using your email provider’s search feature. Try logging in with the email address you think you use for Xbox. Be sure to type the email address correctly, as a typo can prevent you from accessing your account. If you are not able to sign in, you’ll need to try another method. Click Services & subscriptions. It’s in the blue bar at the top of the screen. Click Learn more under “Xbox Live.” It’s under the “More Services” header. This redirects you to Xbox.com. If you see Get more info instead of Learn more, click that instead. Find the gamertag at the top-right corner of the screen. This is the name next to the avatar. If the email address you used to sign in associated with your Xbox live account, you should see your gamertag. If you don’t see your gamertag, try to sign in with another email address. If you are unable to recover your Microsoft password using this method, visit https://account.live.com/acsr to fill out the online account recovery form. You must answer questions to prove your identity. Your answers will be reviewed by someone at Microsoft within 24 hours. Make sure your Xbox is nearby, as you’ll have to provide your Xbox One device ID (under Console info & updates in the All Settings area of your Xbox’s settings) or Xbox 360 console ID (under System Info in the Console Settings area of your System settings). Recovering Your Email Address (Paid Subscription) Go to https://login.live.com in a web browser. You can use any web browser on your computer, such as Chrome or Firefox. Use this method if you don’t remember which email address you use to access your Xbox account. If you are unable to use this method, try checking your email accounts for confirmation messages from Xbox. You can search for “Xbox Live” or “Microsoft billing” using your email provider’s search feature. Try logging in with the email address you think you use for Xbox. Be sure to type the email address correctly, as a typo can prevent you from accessing your account. If you are not able to sign in, you’ll need to try another method. Click Services & subscriptions. It’s in the blue bar at the top of the screen. Click Xbox Live Settings under “Xbox Live.” You’ll find it under the “Subscriptions” header. This will send you a security code to verify your account. You’ll also be redirected to Xbox.com. Find the gamertag at the top-right corner of the screen. This is the name next to the avatar. If the email address you used to sign in associated with your Xbox live account, you should see your gamertag. If you don’t see your gamertag, try to sign in with another email address. If you are unable to recover your Microsoft password using this method, visit https://account.live.com/acsr to fill out the online account recovery form. You must answer questions to prove your identity. Your answers will be reviewed by someone at Microsoft within 24 hours. Make sure your Xbox is nearby, as you’ll have to provide your Xbox One device ID (under Console info & updates in the All Settings area of your Xbox’s settings) or Xbox 360 console ID (under System Info in the Console Settings area of your System settings).
